maml:description.maml:para: Fetches the authenticated user's account data.
The Get-DattoRMMAccount cmdlet fetches the authenticated user's account data

maml:description.maml:para: Fetches the account alerts
The Get-DattoRMMAccountAlert cmdlet fetches the account alerts
Return items of a defined type
By default only open alerts are returned
Allowed Values: All Resolved Open
Return items starting from the defined page number
Return the first N items
Allowed Value: 1-250
Return items that are muted
Returns all items from an endpoint
Highly recommended to only use with filters to reduce API errors\timeouts

Highly recommended to only use with filters to reduce API errors\timeouts

maml:description.maml:para: Fetches the devices of the authenticated user's account.
The Get-DattoRMMAccountDevice cmdlet fetches the devices of the authenticated user's account
Filters results based on the provided device id
If applied, this filter exclusively determines the results
Filters results based on the provided device hostname
Filters results based on the provided value using the LIKE operator Partial matches are allowed
Filters results based on the provided device type
Filters results based on the provided value using the LIKE operator Partial matches are allowed
Filters results based on the provided device OS
Filters results based on the provided value using the LIKE operator Partial matches are allowed
Filters results based on the provided site name
Filters results based on the provided value using the LIKE operator Partial matches are allowed
Return items starting from the defined page number
Return the first N items
Allowed Value: 1-250
Returns all items from an endpoint
Highly recommended to only use with filters to reduce API errors\timeouts

maml:description.maml:para: Fetches the activity logs
The Get-DattoRMMActivityLog cmdlet fetches the activity logs
Specifies the order in which records should be returned based on their creation date
Allowed Values: asc desc
Return items starting from the defined page set
Allowed Values: next previous
Return the first N items
Allowed Value: 1-250
Acts as a pointer to determine the starting point for returning records from the database
It is not advised to set this parameter manually Instead, it is recommended to utilize the 'prevPage' and 'nextPage' URLs that are returned in the response where this parameter in already included
Defines the UTC start date for fetching data
By default API returns logs from last 15 minutes
Format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ
Defines the UTC end date for fetching data
Format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ
Filters the returned activity logs based on their type
Allowed Values: device user
Filters the returned activity logs based on their category
Example Values: job device
Filters the returned activity logs based on their action
Example Values: deployment note
Filters the returned activity logs based on the site they were created in
Filters the returned activity logs based on the user they are associated with
Returns all items from an endpoint
Highly recommended to only use with filters to reduce API errors\timeouts
Specifies the order in which records should be returned based on their creation date
Allowed Values: asc desc
Acts as a pointer to determine the starting point for returning records from the database
It is not advised to set this parameter manually Instead, it is recommended to utilize the 'prevPage' and 'nextPage' URLs that are returned in the response where this parameter in already included
Defines the UTC start date for fetching data
By default API returns logs from last 15 minutes
Format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ
Defines the UTC end date for fetching data
Format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ
Filters the returned activity logs based on their type
Allowed Values: device user
Filters the returned activity logs based on their category
Example Values: job device
Filters the returned activity logs based on their action
Example Values: deployment note
Filters the returned activity logs based on the site they were created in
Filters the returned activity logs based on the user they are associated with
Return items starting from the defined page set
Allowed Values: next previous
Return the first N items
Allowed Value: 1-250
Returns all items from an endpoint
Highly recommended to only use with filters to reduce API errors\timeouts

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns logs from last 15 minutes
Returns logs from last hour
Gets all activity logs, 100 at a time

The device class must be of type "device"

Fetches audit data of the generic device identified the given device Uid

Return the first N items

Returns all items from an endpoint

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the user defined fields of a device identified by the given device Uid
The Set-DattoRMMDeviceUDF cmdlet sets the user defined fields of a device identified by the given device Uid
Any user defined field supplied with an empty value will be set to null All user defined fields not supplied will retain their current values
DYNAMIC PARAMETERS -udf1 to -udf100 are created dynamically and will NOT appear in Get-Help
Accepts string & null/empty values
SYNTAX Set-DattoRMMDeviceUDF -DeviceUID <String> -udf1..100 <String> [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]
The UID of the device to create the quick job on
JSON body
Do NOT include the "Data" property in the JSON object as this is handled by the Invoke-DattoRMMRequest function
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The UID of the device to create the quick job on
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the warranty of a device identified by the given device Uid
The Set-DattoRMMDeviceWarranty cmdlet sets the warranty of a device identified by the given device Uid
The warrantyDate field should be a ISO 8601 string with this format: yyyy-mm-dd The warranty date can also be set to null
The UID of the device to create the quick job on
The new warranty date that can also be set to null

maml:description.maml:para: Sets your API key used to authenticate all API calls
The Add-DattoRMMAPIKey cmdlet sets your API key which is used to authenticate all API calls made to DattoRMM
DattoRMM API keys can be generated via the DattoRMM web interface Setup > Users > {user} > API
Plain text API key
Plain text API secret key
If not defined the cmdlet will prompt you to enter the API secret key which will be stored as a SecureString
Plain text API key
Input a SecureString object containing the API key
Plain text API key
Plain text API secret key
If not defined the cmdlet will prompt you to enter the API secret key which will be stored as a SecureString
Input a SecureString object containing the API key

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts to enter in the API secret key which will be stored as a SecureString
Converts the string to a SecureString and stores it in the global variable
Converts the string to a SecureString and stores it in the global variable

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the DattoRMM API connection
The Add-DattoRMMBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is used to construct the full URI for all API calls
Sets the base URI for the DattoRMM API connection. Helpful if using a custom API gateway
Sets the base Api URI for the DattoRMM API connection
Sets the base Api URI for the DattoRMM API connection
Defines the data center (platform) to use which in turn defines which base API URL is used
Allowed values: 'Pinotage', 'Merlot', 'Concord', 'Vidal', 'Zinfandel', 'Syrah'

'Pinotage' = 'https://pinotage-api.centrastage.net' 'Merlot' = 'https://merlot-api.centrastage.net' 'Concord' = 'https://concord-api.centrastage.net' 'Vidal' = 'https://vidal-api.centrastage.net' 'Zinfandel' = 'https://zinfandel-api.centrastage.net' 'Syrah' = 'https://syrah-api.centrastage.net'
Sets the base URI for the DattoRMM API connection. Helpful if using a custom API gateway
Sets the base Api URI for the DattoRMM API connection
Defines the data center (platform) to use which in turn defines which base API URL is used
Allowed values: 'Pinotage', 'Merlot', 'Concord', 'Vidal', 'Zinfandel', 'Syrah'

'Pinotage' = 'https://pinotage-api.centrastage.net' 'Merlot' = 'https://merlot-api.centrastage.net' 'Concord' = 'https://concord-api.centrastage.net' 'Vidal' = 'https://vidal-api.centrastage.net' 'Zinfandel' = 'https://zinfandel-api.centrastage.net' 'Syrah' = 'https://syrah-api.centrastage.net'

dev:remarks.maml:para: You will be prompted to select a data center
The base URI will use https://gateway.celerium.org
The base URI will use https://gateway.celerium.org
The base URI will use https://pinotage-api.centrastage.net

maml:description.maml:para: Converts uri filter parameters
The ConvertTo-DattoRMMQueryString cmdlet converts & formats uri query parameters from a function which are later used to make the full resource uri for an API call
This is an internal helper function the ties in directly with the ConvertTo-DattoRMMQueryString & any public functions that define parameters
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example HashTable: $UriParameters = @{ 'filter[id]'] = 123456789 'filter[organization_id]'] = 12345 }

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the DattoRMM BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file
The Export-DattoRMMModuleSettings cmdlet exports the DattoRMM BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file

Making use of PowerShell's System.Security.SecureString type, exporting module settings encrypts your API key in a format that can only be unencrypted with the your Windows account as this encryption is tied to your user principal This means that you cannot copy your configuration file to another computer or user account and expect it to work
Define the location to store the DattoRMM configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM
Define the name of the DattoRMM configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the DattoRMM configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM
Define the name of the DattoRMM configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's DattoRMM configuration file located at: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM\config.psd1
Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's DattoRMM configuration file located at: C:\Celerium.DattoRMM\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the stored JWT access token
The Get-DattoRMMAccessToken cmdlet gets the stored JWT access token

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the stored JWT access token

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the DattoRMM API key
The Get-DattoRMMAPIKey cmdlet gets the DattoRMM API key from the global variable and returns it as an object
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the Api & Api secret key and returns them as an object. The API secret key is returned as a secure string
Gets the Api & Api secret key and returns them as an object. The API secret key is returned as plain text

maml:description.maml:para: Shows the DattoRMM base URI
The Get-DattoRMMBaseURI cmdlet shows the DattoRMM base URI from the global variable
Also include the default Api version uri
Also include the default Api version uri

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows the DattoRMM base URI value defined in the global variable

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the saved DattoRMM configuration settings
The Get-DattoRMMModuleSettings cmdlet gets the saved DattoRMM configuration settings from the local system
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM
Define the location to store the DattoRMM configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM

By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

Define the name of the DattoRMM configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the DattoRMM configuration file

The default location of the DattoRMM configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM\config.psd1
Opens the configuration file from the defined location in the default editor
The location of the DattoRMM configuration file in this example is: C:\Celerium.DattoRMM\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Imports the DattoRMM BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to the current session
The Import-DattoRMMModuleSettings cmdlet imports the DattoRMM BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information stored in the DattoRMM configuration file to the users current session
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM

The default location of the DattoRMM configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM\config.psd1

The location of the DattoRMM configuration file in this example is: C:\Celerium.DattoRMM\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Makes an API request to DattoRMM
The Invoke-DattoRMMRequest cmdlet invokes an API request to the DattoRMM API
This is an internal function that is used by all public functions
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET', 'POST', 'PATCH', 'DELETE'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $DattoRMMModuleBaseUri + $ResourceURI + ConvertTo-DattoRMMQueryString
Object containing supported DattoRMM method schemas
Commonly used when bulk adjusting DattoRMM data
Returns all items from an endpoint
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Allowed values: 'GET', 'POST', 'PATCH', 'DELETE'

Returns all items from an endpoint

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

The Remove-DattoRMMAPIKey cmdlet removes the Api & Api secret keys from the global variables

The Remove-DattoRMMBaseURI cmdlet removes the DattoRMM base URI from the global variable

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the stored DattoRMM configuration folder
The Remove-DattoRMMModuleSettings cmdlet removes the DattoRMM folder and its files This cmdlet also has the option to remove sensitive DattoRMM variables as well
By default configuration files are stored in the following location and will be removed: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM
Define the location of the DattoRMM configuration folder
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM
Define if sensitive DattoRMM variables should be removed as well
By default the variables are not removed
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Define the location of the DattoRMM configuration folder
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM
Define if sensitive DattoRMM variables should be removed as well
By default the variables are not removed
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks to see if the default configuration folder exists and removes it if it does
The default location of the DattoRMM configuration folder is: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.DattoRMM
Checks to see if the defined configuration folder exists and removes it if it does If sensitive DattoRMM variables exist then they are removed as well
The location of the DattoRMM configuration folder in this example is: C:\Celerium.DattoRMM

maml:description.maml:para: Requests an JWT access token using the users Api keys
The Request-DattoRMMAccessToken cmdlet requests an JWT access token using the users Api keys. The JWT token is used to validate all API calls made to DattoRMM
Base URI for the DattoRMM Api connection
Plain text API key
Plain text API secret key
If not defined the cmdlet will prompt you to enter the API secret key which will be stored as a SecureString
Base URI for the DattoRMM Api connection
Plain text API key
Plain text API secret key
If not defined the cmdlet will prompt you to enter the API secret key which will be stored as a SecureString

dev:remarks.maml:para: Uses all the defined global variables to request an access token
Using the define values, sets, converts, & adds the values to global variables and requests an access token
Using the define values, sets, converts, & adds the values to global variables and requests an access token

maml:description.maml:para: Test the DattoRMM API key
The Test-DattoRMMAPIKey cmdlet tests the base URI & API key that are defined in the Add-DattoRMMBaseURI & Add-DattoRMMAPIKey cmdlets
Helpful when needing to validate general functionality or when using RMM deployment tools
The DattoRMM status endpoint is called in this test
Define the base URI for the DattoRMM API connection using DattoRMM's URI or a custom URI
By default the value used is the one defined by the Add-DattoRMMBaseURI function
Define the base URI for the DattoRMM API connection using DattoRMM's URI or a custom URI
By default the value used is the one defined by the Add-DattoRMMBaseURI function

dev:remarks.maml:para: Tests the base URI & API key that are defined in the Add-DattoRMMBaseURI & Add-DattoRMMAPIKey cmdlets
Tests the defined base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-DattoRMMAPIKey cmdlet
The full base uri test path in this example is: http://myapi.gateway.celerium.org/regions

maml:description.maml:para: Fetches data of the job identified by the given job Uid
The Get-DattoRMMJob cmdlet fetches data of the job identified by the given job Uid
JobUID is returned when creating jobs via other cmdlets
Fetches data of the job identified by the given job Uid
Fetches components of the job
Return items starting from the defined page number
Return the first N items
Allowed Value: 1-250
Returns all items from an endpoint
Highly recommended to only use with filters to reduce API errors\timeouts
